issue.message:
Library lint checks out of date; these checks **will be skipped**!
Lint found an issue registry (`androidx.fragment.lint.FragmentIssueRegistry`) which was compiled against an older version of lint than this one. This is usually fine, but not in this case; some basic verification shows that the lint check jar references (for example) the following API which is no longer valid in this version of lint: org.jetbrains.uast.kotlin.KotlinUClass: org.jetbrains.kotlin.psi.KtClassOrObject getKtClass() (Referenced from androidx/fragment/lint/OnCreateDialogIncorrectCallbackDetector$UastHandler.class)
Therefore, this lint check library is **not** included in analysis. This affects the following lint checks: `FragmentTagUsage` `FragmentAddMenuProvider` `FragmentBackPressedCallback` `FragmentLiveDataObserve` `UseRequireInsteadOfGet` `UseGetLayoutInflater` `DialogFragmentCallbacksDetector` `UnsafeRepeatOnLifecycleDetector` `DetachAndAttachSameFragment`
**This is a known bug which is already fixed in `androidx.fragment:fragment:1.5.1` and later**; update to that version. If you are not directly depending on this library but picking it up via a transitive dependency, explicitly add `implementation 'androidx.fragment:fragment:1.5.1'` (or later) to your build.gradle dependency block.
Version of Lint API this lint check is using is 11. The Lint API version currently running is 14 (8.0 and 8.1).
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
issue.errorLine1: updateDestinationText("To: Point (" + String.format("%.1f", mPinPoint.getPoint().getX()) + ", " + String.format("%.1f", mPinPoint.getPoint().getY()) + ")");

issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead

Attribute `allowNativeHeapPointerTagging` is only used in API level 30 and higher (current min is 23)
Avoid passing `null` as the view root (needed to resolve layout parameters on the inflated layout's root element)

Upgrading to at least 18.2.0 is highly recommended to take advantage of the new renderer, which supports customization options like map styling, 3D tiles, and is more reliable, with better support going forward.

Use of this function is discouraged because resource reflection makes it harder to perform build optimizations and compile-time verification of code. It is much more efficient to retrieve resources by identifier (e.g. `R.foo.bar`) than by name (e.g. `getIdentifier("bar", "foo", null)`).
"ok" is usually capitalized as "OK"

The intent action `LOCATION_CHANGED (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `ACTION_POSITION_UPDATED (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `ACTION_POSITION_ERROR (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `VENUE_SELECTED (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.
Using `SERIAL` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Using `SERIAL` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Using `SERIAL` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Using `getString` to get device identifiers is not recommended
Avoid hardcoding the debug mode; leaving it out allows debug and release builds to automatically assign one

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.
It will always be more efficient to use more specific change events if you can. Rely on `notifyDataSetChanged` as a last resort.
It will always be more efficient to use more specific change events if you can. Rely on `notifyDataSetChanged` as a last resort.
It will always be more efficient to use more specific change events if you can. Rely on `notifyDataSetChanged` as a last resort.

`@id/cancel_route_sheet__distance_tv` can overlap `@id/cancel_route_sheet__cancel_button` if @id/cancel_route_sheet__distance_tv grows due to localized text expansion
When you define `paddingStart` you should probably also define `paddingEnd` for right-to-left symmetry
Consider replacing `android:layout_marginLeft` with `android:layout_marginStart="@dimen/login_sheet_title_margin"` to better support right-to-left layouts
Consider replacing `android:layout_marginRight` with `android:layout_marginEnd="@dimen/login_sheet_title_margin"` to better support right-to-left layouts
